title: The 5 Things No One Told Us

items.title: Your tummy still looking pregnant isn't just "mum life."
items.description: For us, it was abdominal separation. Something no gym class or ab workout ever fixed.

items.title: Back pain that lingers isn't random.
items.description: It's often your core crying out for support. Without healing, it keeps pulling you down.

items.title: That dragging or bulging feeling 'down there' has a name.
items.description: It's called prolapse, and it happens to half of mums who've had a vaginal birth. We never knew until we lived it.

items.title: Leaking when you laugh, sneeze, or jump isn't normal.
items.description: It's common, but it's a sign your pelvic floor needs rehab. Ignoring it can make it worse.

items.title: Feeling like your body isn't your own anymore isn't in your head.
items.description: It's disconnection. And the right kind of movement can help you feel whole again.
